verses.esv:
4   The soul of the sluggard craves and gets nothing,
    while the soul of the diligent is richly supplied.
verses.kjv: 4 The soul of the sluggard desireth, and hath nothing: but the soul of the diligent shall be made fat.
verses.niv: 4 The sluggard craves and gets nothing, but the desires of the diligent are fully satisfied.

verses.esv:
4   A slack hand causes poverty,
    but the hand of the diligent makes rich.
verses.kjv: 4 He becometh poor that dealeth with a slack hand: but the hand of the diligent maketh rich.
verses.niv: 4 Lazy hands make a man poor, but diligent hands bring wealth.

verses.esv: 9 And let us not grow weary of doing good, for in due season we will reap, if we do not give up.
verses.kjv: 9 And let us not be weary in well doing: for in due season we shall reap, if we faint not.
verses.niv: 9 Let us not become weary in doing good, for at the proper time we will reap a harvest if we do not give up.

verses.esv:
24   The hand of the diligent will rule,
    while the slothful will be put to forced labor.
verses.kjv: 24 The hand of the diligent shall bear rule: but the slothful shall be under tribute.
verses.niv: 24 Diligent hands will rule, but laziness ends in slave labor.

verses.esv: 58 Therefore, my beloved brothers, be steadfast, immovable, always abounding in the work of the Lord, knowing that in the Lord your labor is not in vain.
verses.kjv: 58 Therefore, my beloved brethren, be ye stedfast, unmovable, always abounding in the work of the Lord, forasmuch as ye know that your labour is not in vain in the Lord.
verses.niv: 58 Therefore, my dear brothers, stand firm. Let nothing move you. Always give yourselves fully to the work of the Lord, because you know that your labor in the Lord is not in vain.

verses.esv:
29   Do you see a man skillful in his work?
    He will stand before kings;
    he will not stand before obscure men.
verses.kjv: 29 Seest thou a man diligent in his business? he shall stand before kings; he shall not stand before mean men.
verses.niv: 29 Do you see a man skilled in his work? He will serve before kings; he will not serve before obscure men.

verses.esv: 10 Therefore, brothers, be all the more diligent to confirm your calling and election, for if you practice these qualities you will never fall.
verses.kjv: 10 Wherefore the rather, brethren, give diligence to make your calling and election sure: for if ye do these things, ye shall never fall:
verses.niv: 10 Therefore, my brothers, be all the more eager to make your calling and election sure. For if you do these things, you will never fall,

verses.esv: 14 Therefore, beloved, since you are waiting for these, be diligent to be found by him without spot or blemish, and at peace.
verses.kjv: 14 Wherefore, beloved, seeing that ye look for such things, be diligent that ye may be found of him in peace, without spot, and blameless.
verses.niv: 14 So then, dear friends, since you are looking forward to this, make every effort to be found spotless, blameless and at peace with him.

verses.esv: 15 Do your best to present yourself to God as one approved, a worker who has no need to be ashamed, rightly handling the word of truth.
verses.kjv: 15 Study to shew thyself approved unto God, a workman that needeth not to be ashamed, rightly dividing the word of truth.
verses.niv: 15 Do your best to present yourself to God as one approved, a workman who does not need to be ashamed and who correctly handles the word of truth.

verses.esv: 10 Whatever your hand finds to do, do it with your might, for there is no work or thought or knowledge or wisdom in Sheol, to which you are going.
verses.kjv: 10 Whatsoever thy hand findeth to do, do it with thy might; for there is no work, nor device, nor knowledge, nor wisdom, in the grave, whither thou goest.
verses.niv: 10 Whatever your hand finds to do, do it with all your might, for in the grave, where you are going, there is neither working nor planning nor knowledge nor wisdom.

verses.esv:
27   Whoever diligently seeks good seeks favor,
    but evil comes to him who searches for it.
verses.kjv: 27 He that diligently seeketh good procureth favour: but he that seeketh mischief, it shall come unto him.
verses.niv: 27 He who seeks good finds goodwill, but evil comes to him who searches for it.

verses.esv: 12 Blessed is the man who remains steadfast under trial, for when he has stood the test he will receive the crown of life, which God has promised to those who love him.
verses.kjv: 12 Blessed is the man that endureth temptation: for when he is tried, he shall receive the crown of life, which the Lord hath promised to them that love him.
verses.niv: 12 Blessed is the man who perseveres under trial, because when he has stood the test, he will receive the crown of life that God has promised to those who love him.

verses.esv:
6   Go to the ant, O sluggard;
    consider her ways, and be wise.
7   Without having any chief,
    officer, or ruler,
8   she prepares her bread in summer
    and gathers her food in harvest.
verses.kjv: 6 Go to the ant, thou sluggard; consider her ways, and be wise: 7 Which having no guide, overseer, or ruler, 8 Provideth her meat in the summer, and gathereth her food in the harvest.
verses.niv: 6 Go to the ant, you sluggard; consider its ways and be wise! 7 It has no commander, no overseer or ruler, 8 yet it stores its provisions in summer and gathers its food at harvest.

verses.esv: 14 I press on toward the goal for the prize of the upward call of God in Christ Jesus.
verses.kjv: 14 I press toward the mark for the prize of the high calling of God in Christ Jesus.
verses.niv: 14 I press on toward the goal to win the prize for which God has called me heavenward in Christ Jesus.

verses.esv: 23 Whatever you do, work heartily, as for the Lord and not for men,
verses.kjv: 23 And whatsoever ye do, do it heartily, as to the Lord, and not unto men;
verses.niv: 23 Whatever you do, work at it with all your heart, as working for the Lord, not for men,

verses.esv: 26 saying, “If you will diligently listen to the voice of the LORD your God, and do that which is right in his eyes, and give ear to his commandments and keep all his statutes, I will put none of the diseases on you that I put on the Egyptians, for I am the LORD, your healer.”
verses.kjv: 26 And said, If thou wilt diligently hearken to the voice of the LORD thy God, and wilt do that which is right in his sight, and wilt give ear to his commandments, and keep all his statutes, I will put none of these diseases upon thee, which I have brought upon the Egyptians: for I am the LORD that healeth thee.
verses.niv: 26 He said, "If you listen carefully to the voice of the LORD your God and do what is right in his eyes, if you pay attention to his commands and keep all his decrees, I will not bring on you any of the diseases I brought on the Egyptians, for I am the LORD, who heals you."

verses.esv:
23   Keep your heart with all vigilance,
    for from it flow the springs of life.
verses.kjv: 23 Keep thy heart with all diligence; for out of it are the issues of life.
verses.niv: 23 Above all else, guard your heart, for it is the wellspring of life.

verses.esv:
5   The plans of the diligent lead surely to abundance,
    but everyone who is hasty comes only to poverty.
verses.kjv: 5 The thoughts of the diligent tend only to plenteousness; but of every one that is hasty only to want.
verses.niv: 5 The plans of the diligent lead to profit as surely as haste leads to poverty.

verses.esv: 6 And without faith it is impossible to please him, for whoever would draw near to God must believe that he exists and that he rewards those who seek him.
verses.kjv: 6 But without faith it is impossible to please him: for he that cometh to God must believe that he is, and that he is a rewarder of them that diligently seek him.
verses.niv: 6 And without faith it is impossible to please God, because anyone who comes to him must believe that he exists and that he rewards those who earnestly seek him.

verses.esv: 10 For God is not unjust so as to overlook your work and the love that you have shown for his name in serving the saints, as you still do. 11 And we desire each one of you to show the same earnestness to have the full assurance of hope until the end, 12 so that you may not be sluggish, but imitators of those who through faith and patience inherit the promises.
verses.kjv: 10 For God is not unrighteous to forget your work and labour of love, which ye have shewed toward his name, in that ye have ministered to the saints, and do minister. 11 And we desire that every one of you do shew the same diligence to the full assurance of hope unto the end: 12 That ye be not slothful, but followers of them who through faith and patience inherit the promises.
verses.niv: 10 God is not unjust; he will not forget your work and the love you have shown him as you have helped his people and continue to help them. 11 We want each of you to show this same diligence to the very end, in order to make your hope sure. 12 We do not want you to become lazy, but to imitate those who through faith and patience inherit what has been promised.

verses.esv: 7 But as you excel in everything—in faith, in speech, in knowledge, in all earnestness, and in our love for you—see that you excel in this act of grace also.
verses.kjv: 7 Therefore, as ye abound in every thing, in faith, and utterance, and knowledge, and in all diligence, and in your love to us, see that ye abound in this grace also.
verses.niv: 7 But just as you excel in everything--in faith, in speech, in knowledge, in complete earnestness and in your love for us--see that you also excel in this grace of giving.

verses.esv: 4 We must work the works of him who sent me while it is day; night is coming, when no one can work.
verses.kjv: 4 I must work the works of him that sent me, while it is day: the night cometh, when no man can work.
verses.niv: 4 As long as it is day, we must do the work of him who sent me. Night is coming, when no one can work.

verses.esv: 5 For this very reason, make every effort to supplement your faith with virtue, and virtue with knowledge,
verses.kjv: 5 And beside this, giving all diligence, add to your faith virtue; and to virtue knowledge;
verses.niv: 5 For this very reason, make every effort to add to your faith goodness; and to goodness, knowledge;

verses.esv: 11 And we desire each one of you to show the same earnestness to have the full assurance of hope until the end,
verses.kjv: 11 And we desire that every one of you do shew the same diligence to the full assurance of hope unto the end:
verses.niv: 11 We want each of you to show this same diligence to the very end, in order to make your hope sure.

verses.esv:
27   Whoever is slothful will not roast his game,
    but the diligent man will get precious wealth.
verses.kjv: 27 The slothful man roasteth not that which he took in hunting: but the substance of a diligent man is precious.
verses.niv: 27 The lazy man does not roast his game, but the diligent man prizes his possessions.
